social_posts.post_text: #TastingThursday w/ @juliaconey from @blackwineprofessionals

Bonne Anniversaire to me. 

CHAPTER 50 🎂🍾🎉

Thankful, grateful, blessed, and highly favored.

I wanted to say thank you to everyone for my birthday wishes. A great time was had, I’m still celebrating, and I’m still on cloud 50. 

Happy Holidays to those who celebrate and for those struggling this time of year. Find some pockets of joy, peace, and rest! 🎂🎉🍾🎄

This was absolutely one of my favorite podcast interviews ever. Food, wine, and travel. 

Link in profile to listen.

Claire: Meet me in Playa on Friday. 
Me: Done. 

The quick getaway I didn’t know I needed to start my year. A few days in the sun and sand with friends who are family. Life is generous. 

#travel #softlife #savor

So excited to get back into the swing of things. I’m “officially” back to work and easing myself into the new year has been beneficial in more ways than I could imagine. From slow mornings, a quick jaunt to Mexico to work on my tan, getting organized, and prepping for another year full of gratitude, joy, and savoring the beauty of knowing that man plans and God laughs. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I am starting off the year with a BANG. I will be in conversation with Robin McBride, co-founder and sister of @mcbridesisters Wine Company at the keynote luncheon tomorrow at the Unified Wine & Grapes Symposium (@unifiedwinegrape). It’s my first time at the conference and I am honored to be one of the speakers helping to bring an interesting dialogue to the wine conversation. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I know a lot of wine news is coming from the wine bottle being half-empty, but trust me, Robin and I are speaking on the ways the wine bottle is also HALF-FULL. A conversation on shifting perspectives and ways in which our industry is still thriving. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
See y’all there. 
#uwgs #unified #wineandgrapes #bytheindusty #fortheindustry

I'm excited to announce that I'll be hosting a wine & culinary tour of Cartagena alongside hotelier, Portia Hart (@portiaatthebeach), and chef Osei "Picky" Blackett (@chefpicky) on April 27 - 30th! We'll experience Cartagena's finest restaurants, signature street food, South American wines and cultural sights over four days and four nights. 

The trip will include a visit to the historic village of Palenque, the first town for formerly enslaved Africans in the Americas and a two night stay on the island of Tierra Bomba at @Blueapplebeach, ending with a lively beach BBQ hosted by chef Picky at @amarecartagena. Space is limited to 16 spots, so secure your tickets now at the link in my bio before they sell out! Tickets purchased in pairs will receive a price break so bring a friend and i'll see you in Cartagena 🇨🇴

There are only 16 spots and tickets are available at the link in my bio.

So, who's coming to hang with me in Cartagena?

Where are my wine trade people in L.A., D.C, and Chicago? 

Black Wine Professionals in partnership with Chablis Wines has an exciting trade-only event coming soon to these 3 cities. Introducing the Chablis Scholar Series led by a local Bourgogne wine official ambassador and Black Wine Professionals representative.

And guess what? Masterclass attendees will have the opportunity to participate in an essay competition for the chance to win a trip to Chablis, July 9 - July 14, 2023, with me.

- Los Angeles: Monday,  April 17th at Hotel PerLa with Annette Hanami - Bourgogne wine official ambassador and Rick Arline - Black Wine Professionals representative. 

- Washington D.C: Monday, April 24th at Dauphine’s with Jay Youmans, MW - Bourgogne wine official ambassador and Nadine Brown - Black Wine Professionals representative. 

- Chicago:  Monday, May 1st  at Verve Wine with Fernando Beteta, MS - and Vernon Jackson - Black Wine Professionals representative. 

- Time: 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM

*To qualify for the essay competition, you must attend one of the Chablis Scholars masterclasses.*

Details for the classes are available at the link in bio!

@VinsdeChablis #PureChablis #BourgogneWines

I am grateful to travel the world and learn about wine as a student. It’s never lost on me. The Rhône has been a region I wanted to delve into and this deep dive this week has been a game changer. I’ve met and tasted wines from producers who are passionate, engaged, and produce wines of various styles and complexity. 

I’ve met new wine colleagues and reconnected with my international wine community. #blessed

Découvertes en Vallée du Rhône is a must experience professional wine event. #DVR2023

Los Angeles! 

Black Wine Professionals in partnership with Chablis Wines has an exciting trade-only event coming up on Monday, April 17 at Hotel PerLa with Annette Hanami - Bourgogne wine official ambassador and Rick Arline - Black Wine Professionals representative. 

- Time: 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM

Masterclass attendees will have the opportunity to participate in an essay competition for the chance to win a trip to Chablis, July 9 - July 14, 2023, with me.

*To qualify for the essay competition, you must attend one of the Chablis Scholars masterclasses.*

Details for the classes and to sign up are available at the link in bio!

@VinsdeChablis #PureChablis #bourgognewines

Printemps du Champagne is a special week of tasting various champagnes. Some are in the U.S., but many are not and it is the best way for me to learn all the complexities and nuisances that make the wine special. It is also a time to reconnect with colleagues who share my same love, enjoyment, and want to grow in their knowledge of this beloved beverage. 

It was a very productive and full first day. It started with a great tasting and the launch of the new digital
 Champagne Guide by @tyson_stelzer. 

Thank you to @bosiechampagne for this magical event. @wineevents_ @residence.eisenhower @my_tribe__ @antoinebillecart @champagne_billecart_salmon @champagne_bollinger @g.derivoire @charlesheidsieckchampagne @stephen.leroux @champagnedeutz @champagnedieboltvallois @isabelle.diebolt @domperignonofficial @eglyouriet @champagne_jacquesson @champagne_mailly @champagne.hebrart @champagnegimonnet @pol_roger @axelgillery @piper_heidsieck @rarechampagne_official @emilien_boutillat @champagnetaittinger.

D.C. Wine Family. We are ready for you. Chablis Scholar Series + Black Wine Professionals 

#PureChablis #BourgogneWines

Chicago!

It’s about that time. 

Black Wine Professionals in partnership with Chablis Wines has an exciting trade-only event coming up on Monday, May 1 at Verve Wine with Fernando Beteta, MS and Vernon Jackson - Black Wine Professionals representative. 

- Time: 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM

Masterclass attendees will have the opportunity to participate in an essay competition for the chance to win a trip to Chablis, July 9 - July 14, 2023, with me.

*To qualify for the essay competition, you must attend the Chablis Scholars masterclass.*

Details for the class and to sign up are available at the link in bio!

@VinsdeChablis #PureChablis #BourgogneWines
Palenque is an incredibly special place. What a joy to visit with such a fantastic collection of humans.

I was running into a wall and took myself to the beach. Much needed. Cup is full again and I am committed to more uses of @vacationinc sunscreen this summer. @myleik, you are right. It is still the best.

It’s showtime for the @beardfoundation awards 2023 🍾🎉

Tuxedo: @zara 
Shoes: @venitaaspen for @dillards 
Wardrobe consultant: @blueprint4style 
Makeup: @lerinjohnsonartistry

A huge congratulations to Loris Anne Jones-Randolph (@boozybushwick) for winning the Chablis Scholar essay contest in partnership with @blackwineprofessionals. All the essays were great, but Loris’ essay stood out and was exceptional. The essay was thoughtful, engaging, and compelling on Chablis. It painted a beautiful picture of Chablis. 

Here’s a snippet from her essay. 

“There’s a buzz in the air. The restaurant you’ve chosen is lively, trays of savory fish and roasted chicken waft past your table. Couples are gently leaning in to chat as you order crab cake and oysters to start with branzino and pork chop with broccolini as the main. Without you knowing, the sommeliers brain begins to turn at the possibilities of pairings for you, until they approach your table and you say “anything but Chardonnay.” 

Like the piercing acidity and crispness of Chablis, the sommelier’s heart is stung with that blow. They can hear the disdain of overly wooded and poorly integrated Chardonnays in your voice, all the while hoping a special plot of land will change your mind. Chablis is a wine unlike any other.” 

I am excited Loris is joining me on an epic trip to the meet winemakers, taste, and savor our time in the region next month. 

@VinsdeChablis #PureChablis #BourgogneWines #blackwineprofessionals

Day 1 of @vinsdechablis and @blackwineprofessionals was an absolute treat. Check out @boozybushwick’s reel for a few highlights. 

#PureChablis
#BourgogneWines

Chablis, please keep giving us all the delicious Chardonnay. Nothing like a Chardy Party in the vines. 

@VinsdeChablis
#PureChablis
#BourgogneWines

Chablis, the home of Chardonnay is definitely more than one note. It is a category that should not be lumped together in the “anything, but chardonnay - ABC” world of wine. In Chablis, chardonnay is more than just a grape, it is the expression of what the land and the winemakers give. Wines that range from aperitif style to sip at the start of the evening to more elegant, robust, and refined. A great wine for numerous dishes and varied styles. 

On day 1, after landing in Paris, we were whisked away to the region. A 3-hour drive from CDG airport and you have arrived in the heart of region. We started with an overall landscape view of Chablis before a tasting at the Bourgogne Wine Board with a tasting of over 20 medal-winning wines from the 2023 Chablis Wine Competition. We traveled by glass through all the areas of Chablis: Petit Chablis, Chablis, Premier Cru, and Grand Cru. 

Have you tasted through the various Climats? 

Climats, are specific to the Bourgogne (Burgundy) region and are designated geographic ares benefiting from specific natural and identified conditions. For example, more than 600 Climats classify as appellation Premier Crus. 

Wine is always learning and these are the fun part of wine. The part where one a taste the same grape that shows itself in so many different ways. 

What have you heard about Chablis? 

@VinsdeChablis
#PureChablis
#bourgognewines

Chablis, Day 2: Part 1

Day 2 in Chablis started with a visit to Domaine La Croix Montjoie (@domainelacroixmontjoie) founder and agronomist, along with her husband Matthieu, the oenologist own the domaine. You could say wine is in her blood since her grandfather was a winegrower. In 2009, after working in other vineyards decided to open Domaine La Croix Montjoie, and lucky for us we get to enjoy the fruit of their labor. 

Have you ever heard of Vézelay? Well, put it on your wine radar. Vézelay is where the wines are created and where they are located create beautifully aromatic wines. This area is high on a hill with south facing slopes and vines are in a beautiful stony clay and limestone soil that contain actually Gryphaea gigantea fossils that you can see when you are in the soil. Wine nerds unite on soil. The methods they use for producing their wines are sustainable, with minimal intervention, and the estate has been citified organic since their 2021 vintage. And good news for us, their wines are available in the states. 

The domaine is names after a cross located at the crossroads between Vézelay and Tharoiseau, which is a “spot where pilgrims coming from Avalon first caught sight of Vézelay and felt overjoyed.”

After our visit, we did a tour of the cute little town of Vézelay and the Abbey is a Benedictine and Cluniac monastery, have a delicious lunch, and to head to our next destination.

Chablis, Day 2: Part 2

After our jaunt in Vézelay, we headed to Domaine Bersan Pierre-Louis & Jean-François (@domainebersan) in Saint-Bris le Vineux to chat with Pierre-Louis. Are you ready? You are not ready. Pierre-Louis is the 22nd generation of this family making wines in Bourgogne (Burgundy). Just let that sink in for a minute. 

Pierre-Louis is not only an engaging young winemaker, but he’s also a huge rugby fan and walking into the winery it was fun to see a mix of wine for sale and rugby balls. Talk about a way to make wine fun. He’s doing that. 

The thing about traveling to old world wine regions is being able to taste in old cellars. I mean, the mushroom mold was everywhere it was like being in a science experiment seeing bottles covered in all this moldy goodness that will help the wines in their aging process. 

It was walking through and ducking our heads in the cellar, where you realize the magic of what is eventually in our glasses these cellars hold all their secrets. 

@VinsdeChablis
#PureChablis
#BourgogneWines
#domainebersan

Chablis, Day 3

Day 3 was another day of Chablis goodness. You would think we would be tired of Chablis at this point. Absolutely NOT. Why? Because when you love Chardonnay like I do, you can’t get enough. 

We started at Domaine Raveneau (#domaineraveneau) with Isabelle Raveneau for a tasting and a visit to one of their vineyard sites. I always like to say visiting a vineyard is bringing my wine textbooks to life. We were able to go into their caves and I love and old, somewhat creepy cave, where you have to duck your head and listen to what the wine walls are telling you. Isabelle was a doll and loved how we started dancing in the cellar because the wines made us do it. 

A stop at Domaine William Fèvre (@williamfevre_chablis) with Alain gave us a glimpse into their portfolio and the range of all their stellar wines. This is my kind of roundtable. Each wine flowed into another realm and don’t you dare think the Chardy Dance Party didn’t happen. It did. 

La Chablisienne (@lachablisienne1923) with Olivier. La Chablisienne is a cooperative founded in 1923. It purchasees its musts during harvest to make sure they have full control over the entire vilification process. This coop produces wines from all the Chablis appellations and their range was outstanding. 

It was at this point we realized we had only one more day in Chablis and we were all in our feelings about that. But, the day was a very good day indeed. 

@VinsdeChablis
#PureChablis
#bourgognewines

Chablis, Day 4

I am museum junkie. I can spend hours wandering through museums when I can. We visited the Chablis’ Cité des Climats which is an interactive museum which appealed to Loris and I. I mean basically it’s a way of learning, but also having your inner child truly come out why learning more about Chablis. Truly there wasn’t enough time to enjoy the museum. You know what that means, I have to go back. Yes, I’m already thinking of going back and need to figure out in this crazy thing called life, when to go back. 

Then we headed to Domaine Besson (#DomaineBessonChablis), to  taste with Camille Besson who is part of the sister/brother team helping to take the domaine into its new iteration. As the fourth generation to run the estate, it is a small producer, but wines of elegance and purity and not to mention a great personality. Sometimes, things just click and it was here that I really begin to understand how Vaillons, which is on the largest Premier Cru sites presents wine of such floral aromatics I wanted to bottle it and where it as a perfume. 

Last, but definitely not least was a visit to Domaine Alain et Cyril Gautheron (@domain_gautheron) in the village of Fleys. The domaine is run by the 7th generation of the family and this legacy is pushing forward Chablis wines make that make you want to sing, dance, and sip. The wines have this ethereal quality and it was there, tasting the Grand Cru Preuses that gave me pause. What was happening in this glass and in my mouth? Transcendent is the only words that come to mind. 

And this is why I travel. Why I step foot in the vineyard. To taste something that calls me back again and again. Chablis, did that for me. 

@VinsdeChablis
#PureChablis
#bourgognewines

Over the past year I kept thinking what do I want to get out of writing. After writing for various publications, I wanted to bring back my voice on wine, the good, the bad, and the ugly. But, a lot of it is not ugly. It’s actually joyous.

For years I have been asked about my travels as well (before my work with American Airlines) and I wanted to put it all in one place. 

What I want is to bring the community from my social media to a central place and also get paid for my work, knowledge, and years of experience. 

The majority of the writing will be on wine. Wines I am inspired by, along with the people who work in wine, make wine, and their stories.

Travel. The travel guides will be once a month, along with my monthly reading list, wine and fragrance pairing (yep, I’m going there), and monthly beauty chat. I’ll also release the dates and information on my food and wine trips on the newsletter first.

Welcome to the community. Let’s get started. The link to subscribe is above in my profile. 

The first newsletter goes out later day. Santé 🍾

Your eyes are not deceiving you. I’m going there. 👊🏾

I found 10 non-alcoholic wines I like as a wine professional. When a long-time family friend asks you to do the research, well, you do the research and you learn a few things. I'm glad I stayed open because I learned a lot.

This is the first official article for my newsletter and because non-alcoholic products are such a hot topic I wanted to approach it from my work in wine. I did the legwork so you don’t have too. 

Find out which non-alcoholic wines are in my top 10 list at the link to my newsletter, Métier in my bio.

One of the best things in my life was being a fellow at @winewriterssymposium and then later being part of the faculty as a presenter and mentor.

Calling all wine writers, applications are open now. Go to their page for all the details and apply.

Today on Metier, my first in Wines You Should Be Drinking: Massican (@massicanwinery)
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
“Julia, I can’t make any more of this wine.”

- Why?

"These vines are the Michael Jordan of vines. This is all we have.”

- Are you are sure it’s MJ or is it Kobe?

“It’s MJ.”

This was my introduction to Dan Petroski (@danpetroski). 

A little more in the newsletter on why you should be drinking wines from Massican, especially the Muscat + Cortese blend he made with maryamandco. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Link in profile to read for subscribers.

Let the countdown begin! I'm excited to participate in #TheFamilyReunion, an unmatched culinary gathering of color and excellence this August 17-20 in Middleburg, Virginia.

Presented by @chefkwameonwuachi in partnership with @officialsheilajohnson, @salamanderhotels and @foodandwine, the third annual event features culturally enriching programming highlighted by the industry's top talent. I'm thrilled to join this stellar array of speakers, chefs and sommeliers as we share past lessons and focus on building a better and more inclusive future.

SOUL-FULL 🤎

Repost from @mcbridesisters
•
Wow! The third annual #FamilyReunion hosted by chef and author @chefkwameonwuachi at @SalamanderResort in Middleburg, VA somehow managed to be even better than the years before! Praise and thanks to the world class wine team @juliaconey, @sippingsocialite and @nadinewinebrown who curated an amazing program for @mcbridesisterscollection Wines and a showcase of black owned wineries. Thank you to everyone who joined our candid Wine & Culture panel moderated by @tonitiptonmartin and for allowing us to be vulnerable in a safe space. To those who sat for my reserve tasting and heard more of our stories of creation, I hope you came away with a deeper understanding of what makes us tick! In partnership with @foodandwine, @officialsheilajohnson and @SalamanderHotels it was a weekend that filled our hearts, our souls, our glasses and our bellies ❤️

Have you signed up for my newsletter, Mètier? 

This week’s newsletter for paid subscribers is a wine and fragrance pairing. 

And I am kicking it off with champagne. 

Yes, wine and fragrance are a perfect combination and I can’t wait to hear your thoughts on this first pairing. 

Sign up at the link in my profile.

Trust me. You want this wine in your lifestyle. @boydcruwines Community Vidal Blanc 2022.

That is THE assignment.

To read about my love affair with @boydcruwines, check out my newsletter, Mètier. Link in profile to subscribe and read.

*I'm headed to Portugal today for my annual food and wine trip with @upintheairlife and my guide to Portugal drops later this month for paid subscribers.

You definitely want to be on the list.
Lisbon is always magical and I can never get enough of the Tivoli Liberdade. A great location, comfortable beds, and outstanding hospitality.

My first night in Lisbon was meeting new friends and feeling as though I was in the home of Sofia. @sofia.s.place is a must stop if you want to eat a fusion of love and the diaspora. I’m still thinking of the homemade hot sauce that I can’t wait for her to bottle so I am never without. 

Sofia, you are a gem and I can’t wait for everyone to discover your food while listening to an amazing playlist and merging friends who feel like family.

Obrigada 🇵🇹

Quinta da Almiara (@quintadaalmiara) is delicious winery an hour outside of Lisbon. The views are epic as are the wines. It’s always beautiful to be in the vineyards during harvest. 

We arrived just in time to see the trucks pour the grapes into the destemmer. Each visit to a winery always fuels me and gives me a wine joy boost.

This past summer, I was able to travel to Armenia in a wine glass. This was my first time trying Armenian wines and it won’t be my last. Keush (@keushbubbly) sparkling rosé is a divine example of indigenous grapes coming from this region. Thank you @storica_wines for introducing me to this wine region and the amazing wines they produce. 

Today, in my newsletter, Métier, I feature the sparkling rosé as a wine you should be drinking. 

Link to read in my profile.

It will include where to stay, where to sip, where to feast, and where to buy the best tinned seafood to bring home.

In my newsletter, Mètier on @substackinc, I am featuring a Wine You Should Be Drinking: @altacolina’s GSM 2020. Link in profile to read 👆🏾

Talk about a delicious and tantalizing blend. Ooh baby!

Also, we all need some more @pasowine @visitpaso @pasorobleswineries in our lives.

The range of deliciousness that is coming from Domaine de La Taille Aux Loups in the Loire Valley brings me immense joy. So happy to be here and experience these wines at the source.

@loirevalleywine @loirevalleytourism #loirevalley

Over the past few weeks and even now, it feels really hard to write. I’m trying to listen, read, learn, and check on my friends who need my support at this time. I hope this newsletter brings you a slice of joy because we all could use more joy. 

This wine is utterly delicious. Crisp, vibrant, and a perfect wine as we move into the cozy season. 

This is a great wine with Pho. The broth, the meat, and the heat works with this wine. You want this combination in your life. 

Wines You Should Be Drinking, @anthonyroadwine Vignoles

Link to read and subscribe in my profile.

Tomorrow is Global Champagne Day and I am ready! This photo was taken from one of my favorite wine shops in Reims last week. Zoom in at the prices and now you see why it's worth it to hop over the ocean. 

I'll be on my Substack Chat tomorrow talking about Champagne, the region, a few of my favorite producers, and where I like to eat in the region. 

For my paid subscribers, I'll have a separate thread on how to obtain those "unicorn champagnes" that may be on your list but you can never get your hands on them. Trust me, I have deep intel on getting them in Champagne. 

Not a free or paid subscriber? Support my work at the link in my bio. 

#ChampagneDay 🍾

Happy #ChampagneDay 2023. 

May you practice the art of sabrage, your glasses be full (no flutes ever), visit the oldest chamapgne caves, and the joy of "à la volée" (disgorgement by hand) be with you all. 🍾

See y'all later on my @substackinc Chat chatting about my favorite champagnes, my next trip to Champagne (yes you can join), and the champagne that gave me goosebumps in 2016 that started me on my bubbles journey.

Paid subscribers get a list of my current top 5 champagnes in rotation and stores. Plus, the best champagne dupe for Extra Old, Extra Brut.

I'm excited to participate in the Gala for Good Auction, in partnership with @americanair and @beardfoundation tomorrow in NYC.

Link to the current auction at the link in my profile. 🍷

This year for Giving Tuesday, we ask you to donate to the collaborative fundraising effort put forth by The Diversity in Wine Leadership Forum and SommFoundation (@sommfoundation).

All donations can be made at the link above and are distributed equally among the Forum members for efforts to support annual events, educational scholarships, job placements, mentorship programs, support stipends, and more.

I have been a part of the Diversity in Wine Leadership Forum since the beginning and it is has been one of the most rewarding experiences as we continue to support and lift each other up collectively. 

There is still so much to be done to create an equitable wine industry and we need your support more than ever now.

Birthday Bubbles for the Birthday Girl!

Today is my 51st birthday and what I am doing is nothing. When I say, nothing. I mean, sipping bubbly, watching First Take, Reacher, finishing an advanced copy of a dear friend’s book coming out in February, and NOT working. For the past few years, life has been LIFE~ing.

2024 brings new blessings, possibilities,  memories, adventures, professional and personal bucket list items. And I am here for all of it. 

This is the joy I’m taking into the rest of the year and 2024. Disgorging champagne in Champagne on Global Champagne Day! 

Chapter 51, #LFG

Newsletter subscribers, I get a little more personal and my full review on these bottles. Link in profile to subscribe. 

- Champagne Marguet Shaman 19 Brut Nature Grand Cru (@champagne_marguet)

- Codorníu Brut Sparkling Non-Alcoholic Wine (@codorniuglobal)

- Champagne Pierre Gimonnet Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut (@champagnegimonnet)

- Oddbird Blanc de Blancs Sparkling Non-Alcoholic Wine (@oddbird | @thezeroproof)

- Champagne Tom Gauditiabois Exploration | 03 2018 (@tom.gauditiabois)

Thank goodness for the @coravin sparkling wine preservation system. It's getting good use today 🤣

The only thing I am making sure I do in 2024 is have FUN! 

Over the past few years fun was lacking from my life. After seeing @usher in Paris in October I couldn’t stop talking about how I miss roller skating and ice skating. 

Since I’m not close to an ice rink, my husband gave me such a thoughtful gift - these gorgeous skates and also all the accoutrements. At this age I am not trying to fall and break something 🤣Helmet, knee, and wrist pads for the win. I mean I used to be all over Almeda Skate Rink in Houston back in the day. 

I’ve been skating everyday, working on my drills, and watching YouTube videos on the terminology. I’ve been smiling the entire time.

Needless to say I am going to be team checked bag because I have found skating groups to coincide with a few work trips. 

Excited for all the fun I will be having. 🛼

HAPPY NEW YEAR 🎉
